title: Somerville-area Sledding
name: Somerville-area Sledding
description:
A Map by Tracy_the_astonishing

A little urban sledding makes the long winter bearable here in New England. If your sledding spots aren't on the map, please add them! 

Add your sledding spots in Somerville, Cambridge, Arlington, Medford...

Sledding can be dangerous. If your sledding spot has any special characteristics, be sure to mention them.

****

kids, kid-friendly, sledding, toboganning, sliding, fast, wheee, whoosh, downhill, snow, winter, family, kidfriendly, get wet, out in the cold, play, danger, speed

properties.name: Between S'ville High and the libraray
properties.description: Posted by Jmoeling A small but fun and easy to get to hill. It ends into a small parking lot so cars may be in the way. A great choice if you are walking distance from Somerville High School!

properties.name: Danehey park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   99 sherman street, cambridge, MAGreat sledding here, plus there\'s a playground! This park is wonderful all year \'round. There\'s a little parking, but not much.

properties.name: Hrad
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing410 Belmont Street Watertown, MA 02472

properties.name: Larz Andersen Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  23 Newton Street, Brookline, MAHills are huge and there\'s parking (which is important in Brookline). Smaller hills are available for those who don\'t want the long rides (and long walk back up). My 17 year old son says it\'s particularly great at night. -Julie, Brookline (boston.com)

properties.name: Oakley Country Club
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   410 Belmont Street Watertown, MA 02472 It has a great incline and a good run. I\'ve been going there since I was 5. -Jim, Belmont

properties.name: Sledding Hill
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   There\'s as nice little hill behind the Matignon high school. It leads down onto the back end of the school\'s parking lot. It\'s not a very big hill, but there is one sweet spot where you get a little ramp effect and you can catch some air.

properties.name: Sledding Hill - Fresh Pond
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   This is pretty nice sledding hill. It is really long in one part, leading out over a flat frozen area. Closer to the parking lot there are some mini-hills for toddlers. It is pretty crowded on a nice day. The main problem is parking. There is a lot, but you can\'t park in it unless you have a valid Cambridge parking permit. Dogs are allowed in the park.

properties.name: The Bowl
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   jamaica plain, MAFor kids with adults, we recommend "The Bowl" next to Jamaica Pond. As the name implies, it is a bowl. You can get enough momentum going down one side of the bowl that you go up the other side and come down again. Because it is a bowl you don\'t need to worry about kids crashing into trees or sliding into the road. So it is pretty safe for young kids.

properties.name: Veasey Park
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing197 Washington St., Groveland MAVeasey Park, Entrance at the intersection of Washington St and Coleman Rd., Huge hill, tons of on street parking. Excellent place to sled north of boston. Nearby, if you like to ski or board, there is Ski Bradford. Inexpensive and easy to get to. A gem north of the city.

properties.name: arnold arboretum
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Sledding, beautiful trees
